title: The week in tennis: Sinner cements the No. 1 ranking, Nadal sets retirement date
description: Sinner will end the year at No. 1 -- while Sabalenka has a chance to as well. And Nadal confirmed his final tournament.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Forehands, titles and what-ifs: How Rafael Nadal broke tennis math
description: As Rafael Nadal announces his upcoming retirement, it's worth remembering just how much he stands out when looking at the raw numbers.
author: Bill Connelly

title: De Minaur survives scare, reaches Antwerp QFs
description: Could Alex de Minaur be set to ignite a late charge to qualify for his maiden appearance at the Nitto ATP Finals? The 25-year-old dug deep to survive a scare Wednesday at the European Open in Antwerp to claim a victory upon return to tour-level action. De Minaur got off to a sluggish start in his first match since the US Open quarter-finals but rallied from a set down to defeat Roberto Carballes Baena 2-6, 6-4, 6-2 to book his spot in the last eight. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never easy coming back from injury, so I am happy I was able to win today,‚Äù said de Minaur, who has been nursing a hip injury that forced him out of the Asian swing. ‚ÄúIt took a lot of fight and effort, so I‚Äôm happy to get a first win here in Antwerp. ‚ÄúThe match is never over until the last point, that‚Äôs what I always tell myself. I‚Äôm always going to compete until the very end and it‚Äôs helped me win a lot of matches, so I better keep doing it.‚Äù [ATP APP] De Minaur is currently ninth in the PIF ATP Live Race To Turin, 425 points behind eighth-placed Andrey Rublev, who is in action Thursday in Stockholm. The Australian, who reached the 2020 final in Antwerp, began to find his rhythm in the second set, during which he won 83 per cent (10/12) of points behind his first serve, but ultimately clicked into gear in a gruelling deciding set, prevailing in two hours, 18 minutes. The top seed will next face Hugo Gaston, who edged Mariano Navone in a thrilling second-round clash. The Frenchman held his nerve to earn a 6-4, 6-7(3), 7-6(4) triumph in two hours, 50 minutes. Earlier, Roberto Bautista Agut produced a steely performance against Tomas Martin Etcheverry to become the oldest quarter-finalist in Antwerp tournament history. The 36-year-old Spaniard claimed a commanding 7-6(2), 6-4 win in the pair‚Äôs maiden Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting.Third seed Felix Auger-Aliassime closed the day by rallying past Marton Fucsovics 6-7(4), 6-4, 6-2. The Canadian often applied pressure on Fucsovics‚Äô serve and created 13 break chances, converting three of them, according to Infosys ATP Stats. Auger-Aliassime broke for the first time at 3-3 in the second set and built upon his momentum to improve to 3-2 in his Lexus ATP Head2Head series with Fucsovics. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Ruud, Paul march into Stockholm QFs
description: Casper Ruud marked his first appearance at the BNP Paribas Nordic Open since 2019 with a hard-fought win Wednesday against Lorenzo Sonego. The second seed was dialled in throughout the contest, prevailing 6-3, 7-6(3) to become the first Norwegian player to record a match win in Stockholm tournament history. Ruud, who is currently seventh in the PIF ATP Live Race To Turin, took another step towards qualification for the Nitto ATP Finals. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt won many matches lately, so this was a nice win,‚Äù said Ruud, who improved to 5-0 in the pair‚Äôs Lexus ATP Head2Head series. ‚ÄúIt was great to get my first win in Stockholm.‚Äù QF bound üí•@CasperRuud98 | @sthlm_open| #bnpparibasnordicopen pic.twitter.com/TPpgfJ9jku‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) October 16, 2024 Ruud got off to a blistering start, winning 80 per cent (12/15) of points behind his first delivery in a 39-minute opening set, according to Infosys ATP Stats. Despite a second-set fightback from the Italian, Ruud held his nerve in a tie-break to advance to the quarter-finals. The 25-year-old will next face seventh seed Tallon Griekspoor, who edged past British qualifier Jacob Fearnley 7-6(0), 6-3. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be really tough, Tallon is a great player, especially indoors,‚Äù said Ruud. ‚ÄúHe has big weapons, a big serve. I am just going to do my best.‚Äù [ATP APP] Fourth seed Tommy Paul clinched a personal-best 42nd win of the season with a 6-2, 7-6(2) victory over Laslo Djere. The American, who won the title in Stockholm in 2021, had to rally back from a break down in the second set, but stood firm to cross the line in one hour, 38 minutes. Paul, who is currently 11th in the PIF ATP Live Race To Turin, is bidding to ignite a late charge to qualify for his maiden Nitto ATP Finals. The 27-year-old trails eight-placed Andrey Rublev by 645 points. Earlier, wild card Stan Wawrinka produced a vintage performance against sixth seed Brandon Nakashima to become the second oldest player to record a match win in tournament history (Phillips-Moore, 40, in 1997). The 39-year-old was imperious in his service games en route to a 6-4, 6-4 victory over the American. Wawrinka will next face Spaniard Alejandro Davidovich Fokina for a spot in the quarter-finals. On a day of Swiss success in the Swedish capital, Dominic Stricker also claimed a statement triumph to upset Matteo Berrettini 7-6(6), 6-4. The 22-year-old saved two set points in a thrilling first-set tie-break, before converting a crucial break in the tenth game of the second to seal victory. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: The Best Tennis Players Do These 3 Things - Essential Tennis Podcast #412
description: If you want to be a great tennis player then you MUST do the three things revealed in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, PERIOD. The best players on your local courts do them and the weakest ones don‚Äôt, so don‚Äôt miss any of these insights because they‚Äôll level up your game fast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Advanced Doubles Tactics - Essential Tennis Podcast #411
description: If you‚Äôre a doubles player looking to take your game to the next level then this is the episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast you've been waiting for. You‚Äôre about to learn 3 advanced tactics that will pressure your opponents and win you free points.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Fearnley's 13-match winning streak ends in Stockholm
description: Britain's Jacob Fearnley sees his 13-match winning streak come to an end with a defeat by Dutch opponent Tallon Griekspoor in Stockholm.

title: What happens next in Sinner doping case?
description: News that Jannik Sinner, the men's world number one, had failed two doping tests stunned tennis. BBC Sport examines the key questions at hand.

title: Jannik Sinner‚Äôs Doping Scandal: Why the Silence from Tennis Media?
description: When news broke that Italian tennis star Jannik Sinner tested positive for the banned substance clostebol twice, one might have expected a media storm. After all, doping scandals in sports, especially involving top athletes, usually lead to days, if not weeks, of intensive coverage, punditry, and endless headlines. Yet here we are, two months later, ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Sinner Defeats Djokovic to Win Shanghai Rolex Masters
description: Jannik Sinner is the 2024 Shanghai Masters champion after defeating Novak Djokovic 7-6(4), 6-3. Another clean performance from him and the typical display of precision hitting that has propelled him to the world‚Äôs number-one spot this season. The Italian headed in as the betting favourite, and after a tight first set that resulted in a ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
